newsitem.title: GERMANY: Siemens to build power plant in Brazil.
newsitem.headline: Siemens to build power plant in Brazil.

text.p: German industrial group Siemens AG said on Friday it won a $300 million contract to build a steam power plant in Brazil.
The 235 megawatt plant would provide steam power for Companhia Siderurgica Nacional (CSN), Latin America's largest steel producer, and would take 30 months to build, Siemens said in a statement.
Brazilian Siemens Ltda would provide local content amounting to 60 percent of the contract's value, while Siemens power generation unit (KWU) would handle the imported share.

Siemens Ltda president Hermann Wever said the company expected "major market opportunities for thermal power plants" similar to the CSN order, now that Brazil has liberalised and privatised its power industry.
"I anticipate in the next few years a considerable demand for such plants -- with private industry playing a primary role," he said in a statement.
The CSN plant would enable the steel maker to cut energy costs and halve its use of power from public sources.
In the six-month period to March 31, KWU's sales fell 28 percent to 2.4 billion marks ($1.4 billion), while orders dropped 20 percent to four billion marks.
-- Neal Boudette, Bonn Newsroom, +49-228 26097150 ($ = 1.753 German Marks)
